column4: does anyone know why ubuntu will detect wireless networks, but not connect to them?
damn.. it originally worked straight off the install, but when I installed wifi-radar, it stopped working
to use wifi-radar you need to edit /etc/interfaces
I tried removing wifi-radar and it still wouldn't connect after I got rid of it
detects fine and dandy, just doesn't connect
Do the connections have an icon next them
not following you. what do you mean?
left click on the nm-applet... the dropdown menu should list available connections
open System > Administration > Network and set your wireless connection to roaming
ok, done. How can I check to see if I have an IP assigned to my wireless?
now go to the nm-applet and see if you have a list of access points
yes, I do. Only one, the network I'm hard wired into right now and trying to connect to wirelessly.
yep. I'm 30% done downloading a 700 mb file, so I'm a bit hesitant to unplug the ethernet and test it
is there a terminal command I can execute to see if I have an IP assigned to my wireless?
ok when you finish download disconnect the hardwire and logout/in........should update nm-applet listings
